abstract: Sets the navigation bar items for this view.

declaration.code: nonisolated func navigationBarItems<L, T>(leading: L, trailing: T) -> some View where L : View, T : View

overview:
## Discussion

Use `navigationBarItems(leading:trailing:)` to add navigation bar items to the leading and trailing edges of the navigation bar for this view.

This modifier only takes effect when this view is inside of and visible within a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/NavigationView].

On iOS 14 and later, the leading item supplements a visible back button, instead of replacing it, by default. To hide the back button, use [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View/navigationBarBackButtonHidden(_:)].

The example below adds buttons to the leading and trailing edges of the button area of the navigation view:

items.description: Sets the title in the navigation bar for this view.
items.name: navigationBarTitle(_:)

items.description: Sets the title and display mode in the navigation bar for this view.
items.name: navigationBarTitle(_:displayMode:)

items.description: Sets the navigation bar items for this view.
items.name: navigationBarItems(leading:)

items.description: Configures the navigation bar items for this view.
items.name: navigationBarItems(trailing:)

items.description: Hides the navigation bar for this view.
items.name: navigationBarHidden(_:)

items.description: Sets the visibility of the status bar.
items.name: statusBar(hidden:)

items.description: Adds a context menu to the view.
items.name: contextMenu(_:)

title: navigationBarItems(leading:trailing:)
